evolution.config.debug.desc: Settings used to debug the game.
evolution.config.debug.renderHeightmap.d: Render an overlay on top of blocks which shows the world heightmaps.
evolution.config.debug.sky.desc: Settings used to debug the sky.
evolution.config.debug.sky.celestialEqua: Shows a red line in the skies representing the Celestial Equator.
evolution.config.debug.sky.celestialForc: Shows all the debug options on this list, regardless of the individual config of each option.
evolution.config.debug.sky.celestialPole: Shows two dots in the skies, the red one represents the Celestial North Pole, while the blue one represents the Celestial South Pole.
evolution.config.debug.sky.ecliptic.desc:
Shows a magenta line in the skies representing the Ecliptic (the plane of the orbit of the Earth around the Sun).
Four dots are present on this line:
 - The Lime Dot represents the March Equinox (RA = 0h)
 - The Yellow Dot represents the June Solstice (RA = 6h)
 - The Orange Dot represents the September Equinox (RA = 12h)
 - The White Dot represents the December Solstice (RA = 18h)
evolution.config.debug.sky.planets.desc:
Show outlines around the planets in the sky to better identify them.
Red is Mercury.
Orange is Venus.
Yellow is Mars.
Green is Jupiter.
Blue is Saturn.
Grey is the Moon.
evolution.config.debug.sky.sunPath.desc: Shows a green line in the skies representing the path of the Sun throughout the day.
evolution.config.dynamicLighting.desc: Settings related to dynamic lighting (light emitted by entities).
evolution.config.dynamicLighting.enabled: Toggles the dynamic lighting system. When enabled, items in your hand, like torches, will be able to light up your surroundings. Players will always be affected. Dropped items and other entities can be toggled separately.
evolution.config.dynamicLighting.entitie: Toggles whether entities other than players and items will be able to emit light.
evolution.config.dynamicLighting.items.d: Toggles whether items dropped on the ground will be able to emit light.
evolution.config.dynamicLighting.tickrat: How frequently should dynamic lights refresh, in ticks. Lower values will produce more consistency results but will have a greater impact on performance. Higher values will produce a higher delay on the lights, especially when moving, but will have a lesser impact on performance.
evolution.config.followUps.desc: Shows follow-up attack count above the crosshair.
evolution.config.hitmarkers.desc: Shows hitmarkers when you damage or kill enemies.
evolution.config.performance.desc: Settings related to the performance of the game.
evolution.config.performance.animatedTex: Use animated textures when available in the current resource pack. Disabling will improve performance, but animated textures, such as fire, will appear static.
evolution.config.performance.leavesCulli:
After how many layers of leaves the game should start to use occlusion culling to hide them. 
Only affects fancy and fabulous graphics. 
1 provides the best performance, but the worst visuals. 
8 may provide only a slightly better performance than vanilla, but the visuals remain mostly unaffected. 
0 will disable occlusion culling for leaves (vanilla behavior).
evolution.config.performance.showPlanets: Shows the planets in the skies. Although immersive and realistic, they do not have any gameplay impact. Disabling them might slightly improve performance.
evolution.config.performance.syncRenderi: Compile Chunks only on the Main Thread
Makes chunk compilation only be computed on the main thread, similar to as it was in old version like 1.6.4. This will slow down chunk loading, but performance may be more stable.
evolution.config.units.desc: Settings that control the units used to measure stuff throughout the game.
evolution.config.units.bodyTemperature.d: The temperature unit used for body temperature in the game.
evolution.config.units.distance.desc: The system of units used for distances in the game.
evolution.config.units.drink.desc: The volume unit used for drinks in the game.
evolution.config.units.food.desc: The energy unit used for food in the game.
evolution.config.units.limitTimeUnitsToH: Limits the time units in the statistics screen to hours, instead of days and years.
evolution.config.units.mass.desc: The mass unit used in the game.
evolution.config.units.speed.desc: The speed unit used in the game.
evolution.config.units.volume.desc: The volume unit used in the game.

effect.evolution.dehydration.desc.0: Your deficient water intake has caused lack of water in your body, which will compromise basic metabolic functions.
effect.evolution.dehydration.desc.1: Your deficient water intake has caused lack of water in your body, which has compromised basic metabolic functions.
effect.evolution.dehydration.desc.2: Your deficient water intake has caused lack of water in your body, which has severely compromised basic metabolic functions.
effect.evolution.disoriented.desc: You feel disoriented and don't know where to go.
effect.evolution.dizziness.desc: You feel dizzy and find it difficult to walk in a straight line.
effect.evolution.hydration.desc: Replenishes your thirst bar by 1 point per [level] every tick.
effect.evolution.saturation.desc: Reprenishes your hunger bar by 1 point per [level] every tick.
effect.evolution.shivering.desc: Your body is shivering as a last effort to keep you warm.
effect.evolution.thirst.desc: You feel thirsty and consume an additional 10% more water per [level].
effect.evolution.water_intoxication.desc: Your excessive water intake pushed the normal balance of electrolytes in the body outside safe limits, potentially disturbing brain functions.
Your excessive water intake pushed the normal balance of electrolytes in the body outside safe limits, which has disturbed brain functions.
effect.minecraft.absorption.desc: Grants additional health. Additional health cannot be regenerated.
effect.minecraft.bad_omen.desc: You have a feeling that something bad is coming.
effect.minecraft.conduit_power.desc:
You are being affected by a Conduit.
The Conduit grants the following effects:
 ► Haste
 ► Night Vision
 ► Water Breathing
effect.minecraft.glowing.desc: You are glowing and your outline can be seen through walls.
effect.minecraft.haste.desc: You feel hasty, attacking and mining faster.
effect.minecraft.hero_of_the_village.des:
You saved the village!
Prices will be lower for you. You may receive gifts from those you saved.
effect.minecraft.hunger.desc: You feel hungry and burn more calories.
effect.minecraft.instant_damage.desc: Inflicts instant magic damage on living creatures. Undead creatures are healed by it instead.
effect.minecraft.instant_health.desc: Heals living creatures instantly. Undead creatures will be damaged instead.
effect.minecraft.invisibility.desc: Renders you completely invisible. It does not render your equipment invisible, however.
effect.minecraft.levitation.desc: You become less dense than air and start to float.
effect.minecraft.luck.desc: Increases your luck. Do you believe in luck?
effect.minecraft.mining_fatigue.desc: You feel tired, attacking and mining slower.
effect.minecraft.nausea.desc: You feel nauseous, your vision is warped and distorted.
effect.minecraft.night_vision.desc: Grants the ability to see in the dark.
effect.minecraft.poison.desc: You have been poisoned. Poison flows through your veins. Fortunately, it cannot kill you.
effect.minecraft.saturation.desc: Reprenishes your hunger bar every tick.
effect.minecraft.slow_falling.desc: Decreases gravity acceleration on you by 8 m/s^2.
effect.minecraft.strength.desc: You feel stronger and deal extra melee damage.
effect.minecraft.unluck.desc: You feel unlucky. Do you believe in luck?
effect.minecraft.water_breathing.desc: Grants the ability to breath underwater.
effect.minecraft.weakness.desc: You feel weaker and deal less melee damage.
effect.minecraft.wither.desc: You are withering, slowly decaying to ash.
evolution.actionbar.attackPose: You cannot attack from this pose
evolution.actionbar.hitStake: You should hit the stake with a Hammer first
evolution.actionbar.hook: You should have some rope in your offhand first

evolution.advancements.stone_age.root.de:
Our adventure begins in the Stone Age
The advancements will guide you!
evolution.advancements.stone_age.definit: Pick up a rock from the ground.
evolution.advancements.stone_age.knappin: Hit a knapping block with a rock to shape it into something useful.

evolution.gui.crash.conclusion: Please, report the issue to help fix it. Despite the crash, you can keep playing.
evolution.gui.crash.report: A report has been generated and can be found here:
evolution.gui.crash.summary: Minecraft ran into a problem and crashed.
evolution.gui.evolution.config.unsaved: There are unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to stop editing?
evolution.gui.evolution.tips.tip0.commen: Evolution is made to be simple to understand while also having a lot of depth in its mechanics. Most of them are best learned through gameplay; through trial and error. Some tips are available down below, in order of importance, if you want to read them. They are spoiler-free, and are not needed to play Evolution. They serve more as a guide as to what you can expect from the mod.
evolution.gui.evolution.tips.tip1.commen: The laws of physics were heavily considered when designing Evolution. This doesn’t mean that the mod follows every known law extremely accurately of course, as that probably isn’t even possible (and is probably very boring). However, a lot of behaviours in the mod match what one could expect from a physics simulation (considering Minecraft’s limitations of course).
evolution.gui.evolution.tips.tip2.commen: As you may have noticed, the movement of your character is a bit different than what you might have been used to. That is because of friction, air resistance and conservation of momentum! You can’t control your character if you don’t have your feet on the ground, for instance. If you’re running in one direction and suddenly stops, inertia will make you keep moving for a bit (you may even take damage if you hit a wall too hard). Keep that in mind and you should be fine. Also, you can crawl into one-block spaces using %1$s.
evolution.gui.evolution.tips.tip3.commen: Friction is a force that resists movement between two objects. This means that it’s hard to push an object across the floor, for example, if the friction is too high. This force is impacted by the materials of the objects moving: some combination of materials provide high friction while some others provide low friction. Friction is also important when walking, as you don’t want to slip! The higher the friction between your feet and the ground, the less you’ll slip and the more control of your character you’ll have. For example, stone provides a higher friction than wood, which provides a higher friction than dirt, which provides a higher friction than sand.
evolution.gui.evolution.welcome: Welcome to Evolution. Evolution tries to make the game more realistic in many ways while the player advances through the technological ages. Heavily inspired by TerraFirmaCraft, it is currently a work in progress. On this screen, you can find basic tips about the mod, adjust some client-side settings and also visualize the credits.
evolution.gui.evolution.welcome.first: If you want to refer back to this screen, you can do so via the pause menu while playing.
evolution.gui.evolution.welcome.language: Currently, the mod is available in the following languages:
evolution.gui.evolution.welcome.translat: If you want to help translating, go to the official GitHub at %1$s.
evolution.gui.outOfMemory.cause: This could be caused by a bug in the game or by the Java Virtual Machine not being allocated enough memory.
evolution.gui.outOfMemory.info: We've tried to free up enough memory to let you go back to the main menu and back to playing, but this may not have worked.
evolution.gui.outOfMemory.quit: To prevent level corruption, the current game has quit.
evolution.gui.outOfMemory.restart: Please restart the game if you see this message again.
evolution.gui.outOfMemory.summary: Minecraft has run out of memory.

evolution.easter.chert: The stars were beautiful, weren't they?
evolution.easter.gabbro: Have you ever stared at a cyclone for so long, it started to hypnotize you?
evolution.easter.gneiss: Sometimes it feels like just yesterday they were playing their harmonica around the campfire...
evolution.easter.slate: I'm here for the rocket science and the marshmallows.
